name: vsbloom
description: Overhauls VSCode's look, theme, and feel by adding a variety of customizable animations and 'eye candy' to the UI.

commands.title: VSBloom: Enable and Patch Electron Client
VSBloom: Disable and Un-Patch Electron Client

vsbloom.patcher.appProductFile.description: The path to the 'product.json' file associated with the VSCode application itself; setting this to 'auto' will attempt to locate the appropriate path for this file automatically - it's usually located somewhere around %localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\product.json
vsbloom.patcher.appProductFile.markdownDescription: The path to the `product.json` file associated with the VSCode application itself; setting this to '**auto**' will attempt to locate the appropriate path for this file automatically - it's usually located somewhere around `%localappdata%\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\product.json`

vsbloom.patcher.suppressCorruptionWarnin.description: Whether or not to try and suppress the 'client corrupted' warning message that may appear as a result of VSBloom modifying files related to the Electron renderer. Changes to this setting will take effect upon the next client patch.
vsbloom.patcher.suppressCorruptionWarnin.markdownDescription: Whether or not to try and suppress the 'client corrupted' warning message that may appear as a result of VSBloom modifying files related to the Electron renderer. **Changes to this setting will take effect upon the next client patch!**

vsbloom.effectRendering.enableAntiAliasi.description: Whether or not to enable anti-aliasing for canvas-based effect rendering. May slightly affect performance.
vsbloom.effectRendering.enableAntiAliasi.markdownDescription: Whether or not to enable anti-aliasing for canvas-based effect rendering. *May slightly affect performance*

vsbloom.cursorTrails.enabled.description: Enable or disable a trail effect that follows behind the editor cursor as it moves around.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable or disable a trail effect that follows behind the editor cursor as it moves around.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.type.description: The type of cursor trail to use. 'solid' will create a continuous connected trail that follows your editor cursor around, while 'disconnected' will create 'trail segments' that follow your cursor around in a disconnected manner, collapsing into themselves as they expire.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.type.markdownDescription: The type of cursor trail to use. **solid** will create a continuous connected trail that follows your editor cursor around, while **disconnected** will create *trail segments* that follow your cursor around in a disconnected manner, collapsing into themselves as they expire.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.disconnectedTrailSe.description: The lifetime - in milliseconds - of each trail segment that gets left behind by the cursor as it moves.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.disconnectedTrailSe.markdownDescription: The lifetime - in **milliseconds** - of each trail segment that gets left behind by the cursor as it moves.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.color.description: The color of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.color.markdownDescription: The color of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.maxSolidTrailLength.description: The maximum length of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves, in pixels.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.maxSolidTrailLength.markdownDescription: The maximum length of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves, in **pixels**.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.solidTrailWidth.description: The width of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves, in pixels.
vsbloom.cursorTrails.solidTrailWidth.markdownDescription: The width of the trail that follows behind the cursor as it moves, in **pixels**.

vsbloom.cursorTrails.solidTrailSpeed.description: The speed at which the trail should pursue the cursor, in pixels/second
vsbloom.cursorTrails.solidTrailSpeed.markdownDescription: The speed at which the trail should pursue the cursor, in **pixels/second**.

vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.enabled.description: Enable or disable line number indicator effects.
vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable or disable line number indicator effects.

vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineAnim.description: The duration of the animation that occurs when the active line number changes, in seconds.
vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineAnim.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation that occurs when the active line number changes, in **seconds**.

vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineOffs.description: The offset of the active line number to the right, in pixels.
vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineOffs.markdownDescription: The offset of the active line number to the right, in **pixels**.

vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineGlow.description: The size of the glow effect around the active line number, in pixels.
vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineGlow.markdownDescription: The size of the glow effect around the active line number, in **pixels**.

vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineSkew.description: The angle of the skew effect on the active line number's text, in degrees. Negative values allowed.
vsbloom.lineNumberEffects.activeLineSkew.markdownDescription: The angle of the skew effect on the active line number's text, in **degrees**. *Negative values allowed.*

vsbloom.tabEffects.enabled.description: Enable or disable modifications pertaining to code editor tabs.
vsbloom.tabEffects.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable or disable modifications pertaining to code editor tabs.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.enabled.description: Enable or disable the effects that occur when the window becomes unfocused.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable or disable the effects that occur when the window becomes unfocused.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.shortTermUnfo.description: The CSS filter(s) which are applied to the window when the user initially unfocuses the application.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.shortTermUnfo.markdownDescription: The CSS filter(s) which are applied to the window when the user initially unfocuses the application.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.shortTermUnfo.description: The duration of the transition from entirely in-focus to the fully unfocused state described by the `shortTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property, in seconds.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.shortTermUnfo.markdownDescription: The duration of the transition from entirely in-focus to the fully unfocused state described by the `shortTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property, in seconds.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.default: blur(2.75px) grayscale(85%) sepia(5%) contrast(110%) brightness(95%) saturate(250%)
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.description: The CSS filter(s) which are applied to the window when the user has been unfocused for a 'long' period of time, controlled by the `longTermUnfocusTransitionThreshold` property.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.markdownDescription: The CSS filter(s) which are applied to the window when the user has been unfocused for a 'long' period of time, controlled by the `longTermUnfocusTransitionThreshold` property.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.description: The duration of the transition from the 'short term' unfocused state described by the `shortTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property to the 'long term' unfocused state described by the `longTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property, in seconds.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.markdownDescription: The duration of the transition from the 'short term' unfocused state described by the `shortTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property to the 'long term' unfocused state described by the `longTermUnfocusEffectFilter` property, in seconds.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.windowRefocus.description: The duration of the transition from either the short or long-term unfocused state to the fully in-focus state once the window is refocused, in seconds.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.windowRefocus.markdownDescription: The duration of the transition from either the short **OR** long-term unfocused state to the fully **in-focus** state once the window is refocused, in **seconds**.

vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.description: There are two different types of unfocus effect: Short Term and Long Term - This is the number of seconds without focus which will make the window transition to its long-term unfocus effect.
vsbloom.windowFocusEffects.longTermUnfoc.markdownDescription: There are two different types of unfocus effect: **Short Term** and **Long Term** - This is the number of ***seconds*** without focus which will make the window transition to its *long-term* unfocus effect.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
